page.title: 11Transport, Faceby
page.content: In this rural block{public transport} is virtually non-existent, with no railway, limited bus service and no local taxi. The National Bus Company's Service 289 from Northallerton to Stokesley makes a detour through Faceby and Carlton; there are 4 buses daily each way, but the latest leaves Faceby at 4.17 pm. Senior school- children travel to the Comprehensive School at Stokesley by{private bus} provided by the N.Yorks Education Committee. Elderly people are taken to Stokesley Day Centre by private car. The Whorlton area has no public transport; a{family car}is essential and more than half the families own more than one. Children have to be taken to school, doctor, dentist and riding lessons. Livestock needs transport and there are at least 12 {Range-Rover/Land Rover}type vehicles.
